content:
Hey! We're updating the landing pages to adopt a new default title structure: "Features | Zulip", "Plans and pricing | Zulip", etc.

With that in mind, what do folks think about changing the separator in the Zulip app from - to |, e.g., "design - Zulip Community - Zulip" -> "design | Zulip Community | Zulip"?

More broadly, I'd be curious what folks think about the content of the title bar. Currently, the structure is:

  1. One of the following: stream name, topic name, PM recipients, view name (e.g. Recent topics)
  2. Organization name
  3. Zulip

I would suggest:

  1. Show a hash with the stream name, e.g. #design, rather than design.
  2. For topic views, display as #stream > topic, not just topic.

We can also think about the order of information. It seems reasonable to me, but, e.g., Discord/Slack do:

  1. Discord/Slack
  2. channel name
  3. org name
I like the pipes better visually, and like the other proposals.
I suggest to use ・ instead of the pipe symbol
Hm, can you say a bit about why you like that one?

design - Zulip Community - Zulip
design | Zulip Community | Zulip
design・Zulip Community・Zulip - just looks as a better lighter separator :smile:

this symbol includes space around it but if you think that spaces are important as symbols in such strings there is ·, so
design - Zulip Community - Zulip
design | Zulip Community | Zulip
design・Zulip Community・Zulip - no space
design · Zulip Community · Zulip - with space
Mm, yeah, I think the dot looks pretty good (with our without the space). What do folks think?
Filed Improve app title bar for stream and topic views #22969 for just the stream/topic name changes.
